required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety & Effectiveness of Clobex Spray, Followed by Calcitriol Ointment in Management of Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a Consecutive Treatment Regimen of Clobetasol Propionate 0.05% Spray, Followed by Calcitriol Ointment 3µg/g, in the Management of Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objectives of this study are to evaluate the safety & efficacy of consecutive treatments of Clobex® Spray and Silkis® Ointment in the management of plaque psoriasis.

primary_outcome.description: Success was defined as a one-grade improvement in ODS from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Body Surface Area (% BSA) Affected

arm_group.description: clobetasol propionate spray 0.05% Other Names: Clobex® Spray 0.05% clobetasol propionate spray, 0.05%, applied topically twice daily calcitriol ointment Other Names: Calcitriol Ointment calcitriol ointment, 3 µg/g, applied topically, not to exceed 30 g daily

intervention.description: clobetasol propionate spray, 0.05%, applied topically twice daily
calcitriol ointment, 3 µg/g, applied topically, not to exceed 30 g daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis, defined as 3% - 20% treatable body surface area
- Overall Disease Severity of at least 3 (moderate)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Surface area involvement too large (>20% BSA)
- Psoriasis involving only the scalp, groin, axillae, and/or other intertriginous areas

facility.name: Northeastern Ohio Universities College of Medicine

group.title: Sequential Treatment Regimen
group.description: 4 weeks Clobex® Spray 0.05% Treatment Applied Topically Twice Daily Followed by Calcitriol Ointment, 3 µg/g Applied Once Daily

group.title: Sequential Treatment Regimen
group.description: 4 weeks Clobex® Spray 0.05% Treatment Applied Topically Twice Daily Followed by Calcitriol Ointment, 3 µg/g Applied Once Daily

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Overall Disease Severity Success (ODS)
outcome.description: Success was defined as a one-grade improvement in ODS from baseline.
outcome.population: The per protocol population included 170 subjects who completed the 12 week regimen without any major protocol deviations.

group.title: Sequential Treatment Regimen
group.description: 4 weeks Clobex® Spray 0.05% Treatment Applied Topically Twice Daily Followed by Calcitriol Ointment, 3 µg/g Applied Once Daily

measure.title: Overall Disease Severity Success (ODS)
measure.description: Success was defined as a one-grade improvement in ODS from baseline.
measure.population: The per protocol population included 170 subjects who completed the 12 week regimen without any major protocol deviations.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
